notes: Description of the building as provided by the authors. Primary purpose of this attribute is to facilitate the reproduction of the data from the source.
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Number of floors as given by the autors or calculated from the publication. Details of a calculation must be given 'conversions' column.
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Type of building occupation. Possible values are residential, office, commercial, industrial, public, non-residential. Multiple options allowed, need to be separated by commas. If you values are required, please create an issue.
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Sub-type of building occupation, such as single-family home, multi-family home, etc. SFH = single-family home. MFH = Multi-family home. If you use new types, please create an issue.
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: The way the data was measured or reported. This attribute is particularly important when occupation type is not unique, for instance, when a study reports an average across multiple samples or even an entire country. Possible values "case study" for data from one case study building, "averaged" for data that was averaged across multiple buildings, "country-weighed average" for data that was averaged from a country-wide dataset. Please report details in the column "aggregation"
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Indication where the building is found, i.e. in urban or rural context.
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Description of the floor area that has been used for the calculation of material intensity. There exist many different definitions of floor area types, but ideally try to categorize it as 'gross' (including walls and staircases, etc.) or 'net' (living area only). If a standard is specified, please name it here.
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Names of the authors as in the data sources citation.
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Publication year
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Title of the publication
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Name of the publication outlet, e.g. Journal of Industrial Ecology
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Copyright information of the data source. Please ensure that you have permission to use the extracted data and that it is not subject to copyright or constitutes a "fair use" under the US copyright code.
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: For scientific publications its Digital Object Identifier: http://www.doi.org
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Internet address where the data can be accessed (or is described).
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Information about the scope of the study, describing the relevant system boundaries. For instance, if heating systems, piping, etc. were included.
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Description of any conversion or calculations that have been performed with the data
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Description of how data was aggregated. That also includes the selection of the individual material categories, such as 'unspecified'. Furthermore, averaged data as reported in "measurement" must be described here.
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Any other comments on the primary data, i.e. data extracted from the original source.
missing_data: NA or NULL - cannot be empty

notes: Any other comments on the secondary data, i.e. data extracted from the secondary sources. This information should make it easier to find the scondary sources, therefore a full reference and further information, like table no. etc. should be included.
missing_data: NA or NULL - optional

notes: Name of the person providing the data. Optional.
missing_data: NULL - optional

missing_data: NA or NULL - optional

notes: Distance from the equator, https://www.distance.to/

classification_scheme: Heating Degree Days using plain temperature at 2 m elevation at a reference temperature of 18 degreee Celsius
